channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-5948] ActiveMQConnection Disconnect Invalidates Wiring For activemq-osgi Bundle
item.description:
A Camel route is deployed across a fabric and communicates with a master-slave broker cluster on that fabric. The route uses the discovery fabric transport to connect to the master broker. The master broker disconnects the connection to the route due to the following InactivityIOException, which is reflected on the broker side logs.

Transport Connection to: tcp://xx.xx.xx.x:43787 failed: org.apache.activemq.transport.InactivityIOException: Channel was inactive for too (>30000) long: tcp://xx.xx.xx.xx:43787

When the above occurs, the client-side FailoverTransport goes into reconnect mode; however, when doing so it encounters a ClassNotFoundException as follows:

2016-08-02 11:21:11,797 | WARN  | .232:61616@35580 | FailoverTransport                | 119 - org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi - 5.11.0.redhat-621090 | Transport (tcp://nodcrsamqp3:61616) failed, attempting to automatically reconnect
 
java.io.IOException: Unexpected error occurred: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/activemq/command/DestinationInfo
 
        at org.apache.activemq.transport.tcp.TcpTransport.run(TcpTransport.java:203)[119:org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi:5.11.0.redhat-621090]
 
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)[:1.7.0_79]
 
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/activemq/command/DestinationInfo
 
        at org.apache.activemq.openwire.v10.DestinationInfoMarshaller.createObject(DestinationInfoMarshaller.java:55)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.openwire.OpenWireFormat.tightUnmarshalNestedObject(OpenWireFormat.java:429)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.openwire.v10.BaseDataStreamMarshaller.tightUnmarsalNestedObject(BaseDataStreamMarshaller.java:125)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.openwire.v10.MessageMarshaller.tightUnmarshal(MessageMarshaller.java:74)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.openwire.v10.ActiveMQMessageMarshaller.tightUnmarshal(ActiveMQMessageMarshaller.java:66)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.openwire.OpenWireFormat.tightUnmarshalNestedObject(OpenWireFormat.java:445)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.openwire.v10.BaseDataStreamMarshaller.tightUnmarsalNestedObject(BaseDataStreamMarshaller.java:125)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.openwire.v10.MessageDispatchMarshaller.tightUnmarshal(MessageDispatchMarshaller.java:71)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.openwire.OpenWireFormat.doUnmarshal(OpenWireFormat.java:354)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.openwire.OpenWireFormat.unmarshal(OpenWireFormat.java:268)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.transport.tcp.TcpTransport.readCommand(TcpTransport.java:221)[119:org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi:5.11.0.redhat-621090]
 
        at org.apache.activemq.transport.tcp.TcpTransport.doRun(TcpTransport.java:213)[119:org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi:5.11.0.redhat-621090]
 
        at org.apache.activemq.transport.tcp.TcpTransport.run(TcpTransport.java:196)[119:org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi:5.11.0.redhat-621090]
 
        ... 1 more
 
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Unable to load class 'org.apache.activemq.command.DestinationInfo' because the bundle wiring for org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi is no longer valid.
 
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1521)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.access$400(BundleWiringImpl.java:77)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader.loadClass(BundleWiringImpl.java:1993)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:358)[:1.7.0_79]

And then the logs fill up with the following:

2016-08-02 11:21:11,819 | ERROR | ActiveMQ Task-3  | TaskRunnerFactory                | 119 - org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi - 5.11.0.redhat-621090 | Error in thread 'ActiveMQ Task-3'
 
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/activemq/util/IOExceptionSupport
 
        at org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory.createWireFormatFactory(TransportFactory.java:205)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory.createWireFormat(TransportFactory.java:189)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory.doCompositeConnect(TransportFactory.java:134)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory.compositeConnect(TransportFactory.java:91)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.transport.failover.FailoverTransport.doReconnect(FailoverTransport.java:1029)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.transport.failover.FailoverTransport$2.iterate(FailoverTransport.java:149)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner.runTask(PooledTaskRunner.java:133)
 
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner$1.run(PooledTaskRunner.java:48)
 
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)[:1.7.0_79]
 
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)[:1.7.0_79]
 
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)[:1.7.0_79]
 
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Unable to load class 'org.apache.activemq.util.IOExceptionSupport' because the bundle wiring for org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi is no longer valid.
 
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1521)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.access$400(BundleWiringImpl.java:77)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader.loadClass(BundleWiringImpl.java:1993)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:358)[:1.7.0_79]
 
        ... 11 more

It is very odd that the classes that cannot be found are in the same bundle reporting the problem. I don't think a disconnect like this should negatively affect the underlying bundle's wiring. In this particular case, the problem seems to follow the Smooks OSGi bundle. The problem occurs only when that bundle is provisioned and used in conjunction with other bundles.
item.summary: ActiveMQConnection Disconnect Invalidates Wiring For activemq-osgi Bundle

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
if they use maxReconnectAttempts=0 - failover will be used to choose the broker url to connect to but it won't do reconnection automatically. That thread won't be used. Spring under the hood of camel-jms will do the reconnect/retry.

However it does look like there is something shared that should not be. Is there a connection pool in the mix?

Unfortunately the broker configuration wasn't available in the references although we do see similar to the following in each NoClassDefFound stacktrace entry:

	at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner.runTask(PooledTaskRunner.java:133)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner$1.run(PooledTaskRunner.java:48)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)[:1.7.0_75]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)[:1.7.0_75]

The key line in logs is:

2016-08-02 11:19:03,533 | INFO  | 6.0.1-1-thread-1 | Agent                            | \
 
   86 - io.fabric8.fabric-agent - 1.2.0.redhat-621090 | \
 
       org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi / 5.11.0.redhat-621090 (Should be wired to: org.objectweb.asm.all/5.0.3 (through [org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi/5.11.0.redhat-621090] osgi.wiring.package; filter:="(osgi.wiring.package=org.objectweb.asm)"))

I'm wondering why the resolver lost the wiring to objectweb.asm...

I spent lot of time to learn how exactly felix/karaf/fabric8 resolver works. And ... it works

I should've spent more time with the logs than with the code...

First - there's only one ASM library shipped with Fuse: mvn:org.ow2.asm/asm-all/5.0.3. It's installed by default (before creating fabric) with one of these features:

  • pax-http/3.2.5
  • karaf/2.4.0.redhat-621084
  • aries-proxy/2.4.0.redhat-621084
  • pax-jetty/8.1.17.v20150415

However, I can see this in fuse-app2.log:

2016-08-01 13:12:41,742 | INFO  | .fabric8.agent]) | DeploymentAgent                  | 86 - io.fabric8.fabric-agent - 1.2.0.redhat-621090 | DeploymentAgent fabric-agent-86.0.1 updated with {
 
    attribute.abstract=false
 
    attribute.parents=default th-base th-commons th-smooks th-cpisearch th-bpm-hqregassist th-hqsender
 
    bundle.ldap-realm=blueprint:profile:ldap-module.xml
 
    bundle.mvn:org.cheth.amqtohq/amqtohq-bridge/2.0.1=mvn:org.cheth.amqtohq/amqtohq-bridge/2.0.1
 
    bundle.mvn:org.cheth.esb.commons/esb-commons-handlers/2.0.0=mvn:org.cheth.esb.commons/esb-commons-handlers/2.0.0
 
    bundle.mvn:org.cheth.esb.cpi/cpisearch-core-ws/2.0.0=mvn:org.cheth.esb.cpi/cpisearch-core-ws/2.0.0
 
    bundle.mvn:org.cheth.esb.cpi/cpisearch-empi/2.0.0=mvn:org.cheth.esb.cpi/cpisearch-empi/2.0.0
 
    bundle.mvn:org.cheth.esb.hq/visitsearch-hq/2.0.0=mvn:org.cheth.esb.hq/visitsearch-hq/2.0.0
 
    bundle.mvn:org.cheth.soa/esb-hq-listener-hq-tcpip-queue/2.0.0=mvn:org.cheth.soa/esb-hq-listener-hq-tcpip-queue/2.0.0
 
    bundle.pax-url-war=mvn:org.ops4j.pax.url/pax-url-war/2.4.2
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:jboss/jnpserver/4.2.2.GA=wrap:mvn:jboss/jnpserver/4.2.2.GA
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.antlr/com.springsource.antlr/2.7.7=wrap:mvn:org.antlr/com.springsource.antlr/2.7.7
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.codehaus.groovy/com.springsource.org.codehaus.groovy/1.5.7=wrap:mvn:org.codehaus.groovy/com.springsource.org.codehaus.groovy/1.5.7
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.freemarker/com.springsource.freemarker/2.3.15=wrap:mvn:org.freemarker/com.springsource.freemarker/2.3.15
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.hornetq/hornetq-core/2.2.5.Final=wrap:mvn:org.hornetq/hornetq-core/2.2.5.Final
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.hornetq/hornetq-jms/2.2.5.Final=wrap:mvn:org.hornetq/hornetq-jms/2.2.5.Final
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.jaxen/com.springsource.org.jaxen/1.1.1=wrap:mvn:org.jaxen/com.springsource.org.jaxen/1.1.1
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.jboss.javaee/jboss-jms-api/1.1.0.GA=wrap:mvn:org.jboss.javaee/jboss-jms-api/1.1.0.GA
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.milyn/milyn-smooks-all/1.5.1=wrap:mvn:org.milyn/milyn-smooks-all/1.5.1
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm/2.2.3=wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm/2.2.3
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.tree/2.2.3=wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.tree/2.2.3
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.tree.analysis/2.2.3=wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.tree.analysis/2.2.3
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.util/2.2.3=wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.util/2.2.3
 
    bundle.wrap:mvn:org.ow2.bundles/ow2-bundles-externals-opencsv/1.0.23=wrap:mvn:org.ow2.bundles/ow2-bundles-externals-opencsv/1.0.23
 
    ...
 
}

I'd strongly consider checking which profile declares bundle.* dependencies on following bundles:

  • bundle.wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm/2.2.3=wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm/2.2.3
  • bundle.wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.tree/2.2.3=wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.tree/2.2.3
  • bundle.wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.tree.analysis/2.2.3=wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.tree.analysis/2.2.3
  • bundle.wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.util/2.2.3=wrap:mvn:org.objectweb.asm/com.springsource.org.objectweb.asm.util/2.2.3
  • bundle.wrap:mvn:org.ow2.bundles/ow2-bundles-externals-opencsv/1.0.23=wrap:mvn:org.ow2.bundles/ow2-bundles-externals-opencsv/1.0.23

I also see there's:

  • bundle.wrap:mvn:org.milyn/milyn-smooks-all/1.5.1=wrap:mvn:org.milyn/milyn-smooks-all/1.5.1

Is this configured explicitly in one of th-base th-commons th-smooks th-cpisearch th-bpm-hqregassist th-hqsender features? (I guess th-smooks).

Fuse 6.2.1.redhat-084 (GA) ships the following smooks feature in switchyard features:

 <feature name="smooks" version="1.5.2">
 
     <bundle>mvn:org.apache.servicemix.bundles/org.apache.servicemix.bundles.antlr/2.7.7_5</bundle>
 
     <bundle>mvn:org.apache.servicemix.bundles/org.apache.servicemix.bundles.freemarker/2.3.21_1</bundle>
 
     <bundle>mvn:org.codehaus.groovy/groovy-all/1.8.6</bundle>
 
     <bundle>mvn:org.apache.servicemix.bundles/org.apache.servicemix.bundles.jaxen/1.1.6_1</bundle>
 
     <bundle>mvn:org.ow2.asm/asm-all/5.0.3</bundle>
 
     <bundle>mvn:commons-lang/commons-lang/2.6</bundle>
 
     <bundle>mvn:org.ow2.bundles/ow2-bundles-externals-opencsv/1.0.23</bundle>
 
     <bundle>mvn:org.milyn/milyn-smooks-all/1.5.2</bundle>
 
 </feature>

as you can see, it also depends on mvn:org.ow2.asm/asm-all/5.0.3 - so it's aligned with "official" asm bundle from Fuse.

the problem:

org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi / 5.11.0.redhat-621090 (Should be wired to: org.objectweb.asm.all/5.0.3 (through [org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi/5.11.0.redhat-621090] osgi.wiring.package; filter:="(osgi.wiring.package=org.objectweb.asm)"))

which leads to creating new BundleWiring/BundleClassLoader (and in consequence to java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Unable to load class 'org.apache.activemq.util.IOExceptionSupport' because the bundle wiring for org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi is no longer valid. error) is caused by fabric8/karaf resolver that has to recreate wiring for activemq-osgi bundle due to new ASM bundle wiring candidate.

Please correct the profile and check again.
OK, switching to this one... Seems related to ENTMQ-1724

I think the only related fix is https://issues.jboss.org/browse/ENTMQ-1753

the discovery agent would hold a stale curator reference. It was not aware of (or reacting to ) the service reference getting refreshed

https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fabric8/commit/46bff2f236e3710bdb77e77677af9a3ea211f0b1

I also provided some fixes that cleared old references:

  • curator → activemq: https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fabric8/commit/bd17fa0750078af3745bd9f349ad634e600c20a7
  • jackson → activemq: https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fabric8/commit/eb70e0682760255977ace75ad63ec645eae10ec7

Kevin Boone thanks for confirming that the problem indeed occurs in 6.3.GA
Can you show me the logs?
Reopening, as there's some other problem at the edge of activemq-osgi and spring-osgi

Steps to reproduce:

  1. fabric:create --wait-for-provisioning
  2. container-create-child root child-broker 2
  3. container-create-child root child-client
  4. mq-create --no-ssl --data /data/servers/jboss-fuse-6.3.0.redhat-208/_broker-data --group mygroup mybroker
  5. container-add-profile child-broker1 mq-broker-mygroup.mybroker
  6. container-add-profile child-broker2 mq-broker-mygroup.mybroker
  7. container-add-profile child-client mq-client-mygroup feature-camel
  8. profile-create my-camel-amq
  9. profile-edit --feature camel-amq --feature camel-spring my-camel-amq
  10. profile-edit --bundle mvn:grgr.test/bundle-camel-amq/0.1.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT my-camel-amq
  11. container-add-profile child-client my-camel-amq
  12. container-connect child-client 'la -l | grep xstream' # to get bundle ID of xstream bundle
  13. container-connect child-client 'refresh <bundle-id of xstream bundle>
  14. drop any message to /data/tmp/camel-test/in

when mvn:grgr.test/bundle-camel-amq/0.1.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT bundle is plain bundle with single META-INF/spring/spring.xml with:

<beans xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
 
        xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans"
 
        xsi:schemaLocation="
 
            http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans-3.2.xsd
 
            http://camel.apache.org/schema/spring http://camel.apache.org/schema/spring/camel-spring.xsd">
 
 
 
    <camelContext xmlns="http://camel.apache.org/schema/spring">
 
        <route id="timerToLog">
 
            <!--from uri="timer://foo?period=7500" /-->
 
            <from uri="file:///data/tmp/camel-test/in" />
 
            <setBody>
 
                <simple>${id}</simple>
 
            </setBody>
 
            <log message="Message ID: ${id}" />
 
            <log message="File Name: ${file:name}" />
 
            <to uri="file:///data/tmp/camel-test/out" />
 
            <to uri="amq:queue:camel-test" />
 
        </route>
 
    </camelContext>
 
 
 
</beans>

after refreshing xstream bundle, just drop a file to /data/tmp/camel-test/in. The exception is:

2016-11-17 13:15:44,461 | ERROR | iveMQ Task-13233 | TaskRunnerFactory                | 145 - org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi - 5.11.0.redhat-630208 | Error in thread 'ActiveMQ Task-13233'
 
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/activemq/util/IOExceptionSupport
 
	at org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory.createWireFormatFactory(TransportFactory.java:205)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory.createWireFormat(TransportFactory.java:189)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory.doCompositeConnect(TransportFactory.java:134)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory.compositeConnect(TransportFactory.java:91)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.transport.failover.FailoverTransport.doReconnect(FailoverTransport.java:1012)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.transport.failover.FailoverTransport$2.iterate(FailoverTransport.java:147)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner.runTask(PooledTaskRunner.java:133)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner$1.run(PooledTaskRunner.java:48)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)[:1.8.0_112]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)[:1.8.0_112]
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)[:1.8.0_112]

solution: add explicit Import-Package of any ActiveMQ package for bundles containing spring-osgi based camel routes:

<plugin>
 
    <groupId>org.apache.felix</groupId>
 
    <artifactId>maven-bundle-plugin</artifactId>
 
    <extensions>true</extensions>
 
    <configuration>
 
        <instructions>
 
            <Bundle-SymbolicName>${project.artifactId}</Bundle-SymbolicName>
 
            <Import-Package>
 
                *,
 
                org.apache.activemq.transport.failover
 
            </Import-Package>

worked for me with org.apache.activemq.transport.failover...
Resolving now, as I think the solution/workaround is necessary.
